request_pathways.name: Request for Access to Protected Health Information (form-3)
Authorization for Release of PHI (form-2, third-party)
Fax submission of completed PDF form
Email submission of completed PDF form

forms.document_type: General medical release authorization (West Tennessee Medical Group Clinics)
Third-party release of information authorization form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A dedicated 2-page PDF form titled 'Request for Access to Protected Health Information' explicitly for patients requesting their own records, with an alternative ScanSTAT online portal for hospital records.

red_flags: Liability waiver requires patients to hold facility harmless as a condition of exercising Right of Access
90-day expiration clause applied to a patient access request (conflates request with authorization)
Missing non-conditioning statement on the patient access form (present only on the third-party form)
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form clearly distinct from third-party release authorization
Spanish-language versions of both key forms available
Portal delivery option with streamlined instructions ('proceed to signature line')
Email delivery with encrypted/unencrypted choice and risk disclosure
ScanSTAT online request portal as alternative digital pathway

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are easy to find with a basic web search, directly linked from a clearly labeled medical records page; minor deduction because three forms require patients to identify the correct one.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The primary PDF form has zero fillable fields and must be printed and handwritten, but fax and email submission are available; the ScanSTAT portal provides an alternative digital pathway but the core form experience remains paper-dependent.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with logical flow from identification to delivery to records selection to legal terms; minor issues include dense legal language in 'I understand' statements, no section headers, and unexplained clinical terms in the 15-category record selection.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly a first-class use case with a dedicated form and explicit subtitle, but authorization-style language (expiration clause, liability waiver) and missing rights/fee information prevent a score of 5.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: The liability waiver and 90-day expiration clause go beyond what HIPAA requires for patient access requests; SSN and driver's license collection add unnecessary identification burden; the non-conditioning statement is missing from the patient access form.

overall.summary: West Tennessee Healthcare demonstrates above-average patient-centeredness by maintaining a dedicated access form and online portal, but non-fillable PDFs, legacy authorization language, and a liability waiver prevent a top-tier grade.
